org.svvrl.goal.core.layout

Class ForceScanAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.layout.AbstractLayout
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.layout.ForceScanAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Layout

    public class ForceScanAlgorithm
extends AbstractLayout
    This class provides an implementation of the algorithm in [P. Eades and W. Lai. Algorithms for disjoint node images. Proceedings of the 15th Australian Computer Science Conference, 253-265, 1992] based on the description in [W. Lai and P. Eades. Routing Drawing in Diagrams Displays. Proceedings of the Third Asian Pacific Computer andHuman Interaction. 291-297, 1998] and [Kazuo Misue, Peter Eades, Wei Lai, Kozo Sugiyama: Layout Adjustment and the Mental Map. J. Vis. Lang. Comput. 6(2): 183-210, 1995]. Note that the description of the desirable distance is missing in [EL92] and incomplete in [LE98].
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  ForceScanAlgorithm.FSAImpl
      This is the real implementation of the force-scan algorithm.

      Indicates if only push forces are allowed.

      • layout

        public void layout(Graph g,

                   AlgorithmListener l)
        Description copied from interface: Layout
        Lay out a specified graph by this layout algorithm.
        Parameters:
        g - a graph to be laid out
        r - an area available for the graph g
        l - a listener that is interested in the progress of the layout
